programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: A Different Side of Bill Mcguire
programme.desc: A forensic ballistics expert on the stand explains the bullets found inside Bill's remains; a close friend of Bill's tells the jury more about his character and behavior.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Tyler Hadley discusses how he, as a troubled 17-year-old, bludgeoned his mother and father to death with a hammer.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: A Neo-Nazi turned Islamic jihadist shoots two of his roommates after an argument; in a combative interview with journalist David Scott, Devon Arthurs, now claiming to be remorseful, attempts to explain his descent into madness.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Rebecca Keller and Keri Murphy murdered Murphy's mother after she did not approve of their high school relationship; in her first TV interview ever, Keller explains to David Scott her role in the killing and even tries to justify why she did it.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: She went by "Angel," but Alicia Keator was far from benevolent; Keator and her boyfriend killed and robbed John Fernandez, a 65-year-old man who used a wheelchair, after she agreed to take care of him in exchange for free rent.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.desc: After a relationship with another man does not work out, Jodi Arias recalls that life was hard; she struggles to make ends meet, having to work two jobs to keep up with her daily lifestyle; it is during this time she first meets Travis Alexander.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.sub-title: Lovers in Other Relationships Find Each Other
programme.desc: While the both of them are in their own intimate relationships at the time, the defendant and Travis Alexander become attracted to each other; Jodi Arias claims that Travis had been pushing her to end her relationship with the guy she was with.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.desc: Jodi Arias recalls how she and Travis began their intimate connection; details on both their sexual experiences are elaborated on for the jury; early on, their connection starts off intimate and physical prior to a budding relationship.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.desc: What begins as a mutual attraction when they first meet slowly turns into a sexual relationship between the defendant and the victim; Jodi Arias recalls that she felt used by Travis Alexander because all he wanted early on was just sex.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.desc: The defendant converts to the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints at the time her relationship with Travis Alexander intensifies; Jodi Arias testifies on how Travis encouraged her to join the Mormon church and baptized her into the new faith.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.desc: Jodi Arias tells the jury about the early days of dating Travis; she claims jealousy creeped in early in the relationship. Both of them begin a physical connection but keep things discreet, all while the two are dating other people.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.desc: After they become an official couple, Jodi Arias and Travis Alexander maintain a long-distance relationship; the two would meet up once or twice in California or Arizona in the ensuing months, but their newfound romance begins rocky from the start.

programme.title: AZ v. Arias
programme.desc: Defendant Jodi Arias goes into details of how rocky the start of her relationship with Travis Alexander began; Jodi claims Travis raped her in his bedroom, and recalls waking up with Travis on top of her having sex.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: A secret recording of a conversation in a Miami restaurant takes center stage in the trial; the jury and the attorneys wear headphones to listen to what the state said was an incriminating discussion.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors listen to more recorded phone calls of the defendant; the FBI intercept thousands of calls Charlie Adelson made and received after Dan Markel's death; these same investigators contend that the defendant and his co-conspirators talked.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: Even more secretly recorded conversations involving Charlie Adelson are played for jurors; the FBI go undercover to try to get evidence against him in the death of his former brother-in-law.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: The case's lead FBI investigator presents wiretapped phone calls to prove that Charlie is the mastermind in a murder-for-hire plot.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors heard from the defendant himself in the recordings from the FBI's sting operation. Prosecutors took the jury through those recordings in the hopes that this evidence would support their claim that Charlie.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: The state believes that months of incriminating phone calls confirms that Charlie is the mastermind behind Dan Markel's death.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury listens to hours of intercepted phone calls involving Charlie Adelson and others linked to the case; The defendant answers questions from FBI special agent Patric Sanford.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors rested their case to jurors. Now, it's the defense's turn to try to convince these same jurors Charlie had nothing to do with the shooting death of Dan Markel. Later, the State began their cross-examination against.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: The defendant took the stand in his own defense. Charlie Adelson attempted to clarify important details in his alleged role in plotting the murder of his former brother-in-law, Dan Markel. Adelson addressed the very jury who will later decide.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: Adelson attempts to clarify important details in his alleged role in Dan Markel's death; He claims Markel was pushing his sister's buttons following their divorce.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: The defendant testified that his then-girlfriend at the time insisted she have dinner with him the day Dan Markel was shot and killed. The Defense wanted to show how Charlie Adelson didn't have a clue that Markel's homicide was plotted.

programme.title: Dentist Mastermind Murder Trial
programme.desc: Charlie Adelson claimed extortion was the reason he didn't go to police after learning of his then-girlfriend's role in Dan Markel's death. Jurors heard him distance himself from any involvement and culpability in this murder-for-hire plot.
